title: The unwritten rule of League of Legends if you're a jungler...
body: That one game where you have priority over drakes, rng will spawn 2-3 ocean. When the enemy jungler and his team have priority over drakes, they'll get in order 3 infernal, 2 mountains, 4 elders and 1 extra drake made just for that game that gives his team +170% bonus stats, all 5 pieces of Exodia and you'll lose 40 LP even if u're playing normal.

replies.body:
but RNG is healthy for the game

##   - Rito Gems

> [{quoted}](name=Who Fed Ru,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=sOw0kEOZ,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2019-02-04T01:16:57.397+0000)
>
> but RNG is healthy for the game
> 
> ##   - Rito Gems

tbf i understand their REASONING behind RNG of the dragons.  You can plan for it.

WHat I don't understand is their other RNG they put into the game that directly contradicts their statements of acceptable RNG... lookin at you {{champion:142}}

> [{quoted}](name=Hethalean,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=sOw0kEOZ,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2019-02-04T01:18:51.013+0000)
>
> tbf i understand their REASONING behind RNG of the dragons.  You can plan for it.
> 
> WHat I don't understand is their other RNG they put into the game that directly contradicts their statements of acceptable RNG... lookin at you {{champion:142}}

I understand the reasoning behind adapting to RNG, but I still think it's bullshit because as it is now Infernal and Mountain are like 3 times more useful than Cloud and that is another 3 times more useful as Ocean Drake.
It doesn't really add any of the wanted dynamics to the game, and usually ends like this:

Either many Infernals and Mountains spawn, both teams want it and the team with better drake control gets them.
Or many useless Drakes spawn that both teams tend to ignore and the team that has a lead is basically wasting their time if they do it.

Anyway I just don't think that elemental drakes are healthy because either you have drake prio or you don't, and end up either being lucky with them or not.
Wow you must have great team-mates; for me, my team refuses to help me with infernal drakes, but let a ocean drake appear and they cant stop pinging it rough life

> [{quoted}](name=Hethalean,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=sOw0kEOZ,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2019-02-04T01:18:51.013+0000)
>
> tbf i understand their REASONING behind RNG of the dragons.  You can plan for it.
> 
> WHat I don't understand is their other RNG they put into the game that directly contradicts their statements of acceptable RNG... lookin at you {{champion:142}}

Yeah I remember laning vs a Zoe and having her pick up two Heals and an Ignite from minion, back to fucking back.

> [{quoted}](name=Hethalean,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=sOw0kEOZ,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2019-02-04T01:18:51.013+0000)
>
> tbf i understand their REASONING behind RNG of the dragons.  You can plan for it.

Still the whole concept is really questionable. 

Its more fair ground when there was the 5 dragon stack, it made it so that both teams had an equal chance of getting the same buffs, now its basically who ever has the lead has the priority to get the drag, and its likely that same drag may not even spawn for the enemy (first infernal then only getting an ocean second isn't really comeback potential, compared to the original drags where the first one on either team was always the same buff.)
People seriously think ocean drake is useless? Have you seen the amount of regen it provides? You basically have a portable mini fountain
nobody thinks any dragon is useless, everyone knows infernal and mountain are the most useful.

> [{quoted}](name=Boatwhistle,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=sOw0kEOZ,comment-id=00010006,timestamp=2019-02-04T13:16:25.677+0000)
>
> nobody thinks any dragon is useless, everyone knows infernal and mountain are the most useful.

agree

It's pretty useless unless you're playing in a super low elo where the matches drudge on. But once you get high enough, unless it's an early ocean drake to help with lane sustain, you'll find that team fights last about 7 seconds and the healing doesn't really matter.
7 seconds? what the fuck i haven't seen a team fight that long for years
Oh my bad I forgot something. I meant. ".7 seconds." That's for the lookout.

Seeing as Ocean Drake has been key to several teams doing well in Pro play, I have to disagree with your assement.

If anything, it’s *less* useful in general in low elo because they don’t know how to properly disengage fights to utilize the regen and force the other team to stay on the map while they’re not healthy.
Sooner or later we'll have to recognize that 99% of the playerbase does not play high-level premade 5v5s.

That has what bearing exactly?

You can call to disengage with randoms, you don’t need to be in voice calls with them. You can call to just stand back and poke down the enemy without voice coms.

My point of bringing up pros was that at those high levels, regen was a massive deciding factor. It’s not just lower elo.

> [{quoted}](name=Wilk Łucznik,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=sOw0kEOZ,comment-id=00010000000100000000,timestamp=2019-02-04T17:14:09.311+0000)
>
> You can call to disengage with randoms, you don’t need to be in voice calls with them.

Oh you can definitely call the right plays with randoms, it's getting them to actually do it that's an issue.

funny thing: professional queue USED to be the best of the best coming together as a random team to bash heads

now professional play is organized, has changes specifically made for it, most of them do not even enjoy the game anymore but instead play it as a career, oh, and almost every change that has been made for professional play recently has had the OPPOSITE of the intended effect

I think we may have had a miscommunication or maybe I didn't specify well. When I say It's useless other than in super low elo. I'm saying because the matches are longer and as the matches get longer, the more health champions have and the more health you have, the more health you regenerate out of combat from the buff. 

Adding a little to that, I am very aware that low elo players don't know how to properly disengage fights, but another thing they are inexperienced with is health maintenance and knowing when to recall. Especially after objectives like drakes and baron. This drake helps them with that.

Something I'd like to point out in your argument is that you brought up pro play. Solo queue tends to be a little bit different than proplay, especially the types of champions and strategies that are viable. 

In solo queue, people like to play high damage fighters, assassins and sometimes juggernauts. In proplay, you see alot of tanks, cc bots and utility. In solo queue, tanks are almost non existent due to conqueror and more lack of team coordination and communication. Them having more tanks and com lines allows that drake to be more useful.

Tanks = cc and disruption.

Comms = better team play execution 

I'm not saying that solo queue has no way of disengaging fights, but it's much more limited both in characters to enable the disengage and the type of communication which makes the dragon such a low priority for junglers.

As a Taliyah player I literally get wet whenever I see an ocean drake. 

I'm sure Anivia and Cass players feel the same.
And Blitz!
Poor metal mans Q uses like a third of his mana pool per cast lmao

> [{quoted}](name=Wilk Łucznik,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=sOw0kEOZ,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2019-02-04T04:16:35.263+0000)
>
> People seriously think ocean drake is useless? Have you seen the amount of regen it provides? You basically have a portable mini fountain

As many other guys said, it's usefull only during the laning phase. It's pretty useless mid-late game compared to the opportunity of melting a Baron/towers or doing way more % damage.

> [{quoted}](name=Wilk Łucznik,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=sOw0kEOZ,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2019-02-04T04:16:35.263+0000)
>
> People seriously think ocean drake is useless? Have you seen the amount of regen it provides? You basically have a portable mini fountain

Agreed. Playing AP Kog and seeing an Ocean drake is up gets me so excited as I can lane a bit longer before each back. You win a lot more trades over time as well. As far as laning phase goes I'd argue Ocean is by far the best drake. The second worst as far as team fights go however that's the smaller portion of the game.

> [{quoted}](name=Carrie Pigeon,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=sOw0kEOZ,comment-id=00010001,timestamp=2019-02-04T07:05:19.543+0000)
>
> Agreed. Playing AP Kog and seeing an Ocean drake is up gets me so excited as I can lane a bit longer before each back. You win a lot more trades over time as well. As far as laning phase goes I'd argue Ocean is by far the best drake. The second worst as far as team fights go however that's the smaller portion of the game.

by the time you get ocean drake laning phase is already over.

Uhhhh only if the jungler don't know how to jungle.

If you have a Warwick or Nunu they can solo drag twice before laning phase is at an end.

warwick and nunu both have high damage against monsters.  Nunu's Q can actually exceed a smite in damage against them

there are only a few junglers that have this capability and almost all of them suck in duels

Except Yi and Xin Zhao and Graves and Kayn can also do this with proper vision.  Drags are way squishier than people give credit for.

That's 6 jungles, 4 of which are good to great at dueling.

compared to nunu and warwick?  their clear times for large monsters aren't that good.  If the objective is warded, the opposing jungler will almost always come and steal it if possible

you also have to account for this being early game.  yi won't get rageblade for a while and xin, graves and kayne will be focused on ganking

i'm not sure how ivern woks with dragon, but if he works, he is in their league

Yi... Doesn't need Rageblade.  He needs Slayer enchanted jungle item.

Same with Xin I think, idk about Graves, Kayn is warrior.

And all 3 of the can take drag while taking almost no damage because of either lifesteal or kayns case his E.

i'm not a jungler.  If you know more than me, fine, but so long as riot keeps removing incentives to remain in the jungle, gank junglers will be strong

currently nunu and warwick are strong because riot removed some of their old weaknesses, yet even then they're not that popular in higher divisions

> [{quoted}](name=Terozu,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=sOw0kEOZ,comment-id=000100010000000000000000,timestamp=2019-02-04T22:02:33.488+0000)
>

Kayn is not a duelist until he has a transformation.
Warwick and nunu would kill him along with xinzhao, graves, and kindred.

Uhhhh no shit, that's why I said 4/6 of them are good to great duelists.

Are you telling me that Graves, Xin, Yi and Warwick aren't all decent duelists?

And btw no, Kayn destroys Nunu if used right.

> [{quoted}](name=Terozu,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=sOw0kEOZ,comment-id=00010001000000000000000000010000,timestamp=2019-02-06T02:52:54.724+0000)

The way you phrased it made it sound as if they were. 
Chill out.

> 
> Are you telling me that Graves, Xin, Yi and Warwick aren't all decent duelists?

I never made any implication or insinuation of such a statement.

> 
> And btw no, Kayn destroys Nunu if used right.

Not really but okay.

A mini fountain that is useful only at the start of the match. Later it is useless, so it is understandable that we prefer other drakes. Compare it to Infernal. Earth. Or even Air (even tho it is not as good). Infernal gives you an actual advantage over the enemy. Earth helps you with baron and towers. They basically give you all you need to win the game. I also think that if the first drake is Ocean, it is good, but if it is a late Ocean, then it is not even worth taking.

An Ocean drake means you can stay out on the map while the enemy has to recall to heal or refill mana. Late game backs aren’t determined my matching your enemy, but when you have to. If you can stay out on the map and get lanes pushing for you, get wards out, that swings control your way.

> [{quoted}](name=Wilk Łucznik,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=sOw0kEOZ,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2019-02-04T04:16:35.263+0000)
>
> People seriously think ocean drake is useless? Have you seen the amount of regen it provides? You basically have a portable mini fountain

Regen means nothing when you die in like 2-3 seconds

Idk if they know that ocean drake is better for roamers and split pushers than air drake that lets you regen hp and mana as you walk between lanes and run away from people trying to stop you. it might even be better than mountain drake for them too. but thats only really a problem because split pushers are so weak because mages and marksmen cry when ever some one subverts their power by not balling up in front of them to die.

Ocean drake is hell during a laning phase.
Play a poke bot lane, you have ocean and you are god, they have ocean and you feel like someone took your kidney.

Ye but more damage to   enemy champs, more damage to epic monsters and more movemtspeed to get there to deal damage is always better since you know 80% of the time i play champs whit no problem of mana managment or  literally 0 mana menegment.......

Uh Mountain Drakes make you shit on turrets with True Damage. A split pusher with 2-3 mountain drakes is scary.
3 Oceans is fucking busted, though. Your team basically has infinite sustain ,endless mana, and poke immunity.
Double ocean drake is basically a win condition
Why are people laughing at Ocean Dragon? It is BY FAR, the most valuable dragon to have in early game.
yeah, ok, he says, laughing in any fight after 8 min

I'll take 3 Oceans over anything *except* mountains tbh. 

Problem is, I'm in solo q so almost everybody on my team has no idea how to disengage a fight.
I always thought the unwritten rule of the jungle is if someone is complaining about being camped camp them harder.

thats just bad luck and luck itself is a type of skill in that everyone has it to varying degree's and its much better than being crit 6 times in a row from 60% crit that that anyone can survive 6 crits in a row outside of rammus using his w while and after shock.
